result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad J. Laehn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay all fees and costs.
Follow rules of the Department.
Attend any counseling deemed appropriate.
Obtain a COMPAS assessment and follow recommendations.
  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by CALLING the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, to set up an appointment during the hours of 8:00 a.m. - 4:00. p.m. Monday through Friday, at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.
Obtain an assessment and follow recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad J. Laehn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Stauber appeared for the state.  Atty. Drewa appeared with the defendant.
Telephone call to Atty. Drewa regarding the return of a signed signature bond.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  NO CONTACT WITH PICK N SAVE STORES.  NO FURTHER LAW VIOLATIONS.  APPEAR FOR FUTURE COURT DATES.

Defendant Chad J. Laehn in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:45 am.
